intro: Leymus mollis subsp. villosissimus, commonly known as the silky bluegrass, is a perennial grass native to the western United States. It is characterized by its fine, bluish-green foliage and dense, tufted growth habit. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are covered with fine hairs, giving it a soft, silvery appearance. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife.
